title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
sdumitriu - (00:01): Caleb, how come you understand XWiki so well? It's a pretty big application, and you learned it quickly  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:02): Um, thanks for the complement. I guess I started reading XWikiDocument and followed all of the method calls.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:03): That's why the component manager confused me for so long.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:03): Everything just kind of ended.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:03): @Requirement ... "what is this?!!"  
sdumitriu - (00:06): Yes, strange how objects just pop in there  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:07): :)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:14): I have very little formal programming training, a few semesters in college. However I was playing with qbasic when I was 11, mostly just playing Frankenstein with other people's source code to see what I could get it to do.  
sdumitriu - (00:19): Formal training doesn't always help  
sdumitriu - (00:19): I just interviewed a guy today, who studied acting, but did unexpectedly good on the interview  
sdumitriu - (00:21): So the good news is that soon we might have a fellow actor on our team  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:27): A wider variety of backgrounds must contribute to a wider variety of ideas.  
prototypoholica left at 00:55 (Ping timeout: 276 seconds  
nickless left at 01:07 (Ping timeout: 276 seconds  
sdumitriu left at 03:08 (Read error: Operation timed out  
bbc581 left at 05:20 (Ping timeout: 245 seconds  
jvelociter joined #xwiki at 06:10  
sematicweboholic joined #xwiki at 06:10  
sanyam joined #xwiki at 06:40  
sanyam left at 07:53 (Ping timeout: 252 seconds  
mflorea joined #xwiki at 08:19  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 08:42  
npm left at 08:49 (Quit: Leaving.  
sanyam joined #xwiki at 08:52  
sanyam - (08:53): hi,,  
sanyam - (08:53): I am intrested in participating in gsoc 2010 ..  
npm joined #xwiki at 08:53  
sanyam - (08:54): I saw the idea page fir xwiki and I raelly liked few ideas  
sanyam - (08:54): 1.Calender application 2. Google wave integration are on top of my favoutires  
sanyam\_ joined #xwiki at 08:59  
sanyam left at 08:59 (Ping timeout: 252 seconds  
sanyam\_ left at 08:59 (Client Quit  
sanyam joined #xwiki at 08:59  
sanyam - (09:00): Hi..My name is sanyam . I am interested in applying for gsoc 2010  with Xwiki as mentor..  
sanyam - (09:00): I saw the idea page  and like few projects there..  
vmassol - (09:00): Hi sanyam  
vmassol - (09:00): cool  
sanyam - (09:01): 1) I liked Calender application and 2) Google wave integration  
sanyam - (09:02): I have skills in Java, J2EE  and javascript..  
jvelociter - (09:02): hi vmassol refactored a little my import tests this morning  
vmassol - (09:02): jvelociter: yep saw that, will look in more details later on  
jvelociter - (09:02): cool  
vmassol - (09:02): jvelociter: so these tests are supposed to be used for real right?  
vmassol - (09:03): (meaning they have no equivalent in the other selenium tests)  
jvelociter - (09:03): right  
jvelociter - (09:03): they are new tests  
vmassol - (09:03): ok so it means we should vote to move from sandbox to enterprise/  
sanyam - (09:03): Hi Vincent  
jvelociter - (09:03): first we shouldmake the build actually execute the tests  
vmassol - (09:03): we still need some tuning before that though  
jvelociter - (09:04): yes  
vmassol - (09:04): yes  
vmassol - (09:04): and only one webdriver instantiation  
sanyam - (09:04): Could I know more about how should I get involved ??  
vmassol - (09:04): ie a suite  
vmassol - (09:04): sanyam: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GoogleSummerOfCode/ ?  
jvelociter - (09:04): + right now to execute the import tests in eclipse one has to execute maven install so that resources get copied to target-eclipse  
vmassol - (09:04): jvelociter: ah ok  
vmassol - (09:05): that explains why your tests were failing for me  
jvelociter - (09:05): yes  
vmassol - (09:05): this is easy to fix  
jvelociter - (09:05): forgot to mention that in my commit  
vmassol - (09:05): and we can easily remove some part of your code  
jvelociter - (09:05): how do you fix this ?  
vmassol - (09:05): ie no need to create temp files  
jvelociter - (09:05): yes I removed that  
jvelociter - (09:05): this morning  
vmassol - (09:05): oh ok  
vmassol - (09:05): so no need for copying either  
vmassol - (09:05): you just need to pass to surefire the location of the resources dir  
jvelociter - (09:05): ah ok  
jvelociter - (09:05): great  
vmassol - (09:06): are your tests stable?  
vmassol - (09:06): (do they work all the time?)  
vmassol - (09:06): I've executed them on some oldish XE 2.3 (ie without your fix for import) and they're failing in 2 places  
vmassol - (09:07): but not with the same result when I execute them several times in a row  
vmassol - (09:07): btw the delete package  
vmassol - (09:07): should be done in some teardown  
vmassol - (09:07): or in finally block at worse  
vmassol - (09:07): otherwsie they don't get deleted  
vmassol - (09:07): (when the test fails befre)  
vmassol - (09:07): they should be part of the test fixture  
jvelociter - (09:08): yes  
vmassol - (09:08): sanyam: no mentor have been assigned yet even though some mentors have shown interest for speceific project already  
jvelociter - (09:08): I'll change that  
jvelociter - (09:09): yes the tests are stable  
jvelociter - (09:09): provided they did not failed the first time  
vmassol - (09:09): ok that's good  
vmassol - (09:11): sanyam: yes you can use the mailing list if you want to send a proposal  
jvelociter - (09:22): vmassol: did I miss the decision to bundle Mail.WebHome in different languages in XE ?  
vmassol - (09:22): jvelociter: I think  
jvelociter - (09:23): I see there are 5 more languages besides english  
jvelociter - (09:23): oh, ok  
jvelociter - (09:23): so that's normal  
vmassol - (09:23): although I"m not sure  
vmassol - (09:23): I don't think we had finished our discussion  
vmassol - (09:23): and thomas probably pushed it  
vmassol - (09:23): but I may be wrong  
vmassol - (09:24): in any case if you don't think it's right, you can raise it on the list  
vmassol - (09:24): the alternative is costly: ie have different distribution XARs  
vmassol - (09:25): OTOH we should probably provide a way for users to remove all translations for a given language in the admin or something like that  
vmassol - (09:25): or even better  
jvelociter - (09:25): no it's ok. actually it's good, it makes a old bug in countDocuments pop up  
jvelociter - (09:25): now I have to fix it :)  
vmassol - (09:25): ask when you do the import  
vmassol - (09:25): to have a filter on import  
jvelociter - (09:25): yes  
jvelociter - (09:25): by language  
jvelociter - (09:25): that would be nice  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:28): Is it okay for a selenium test to create a velocity script to do something it has to do over and over in order to improve performance?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:34): I made the RegisterTest test liveValidation, then change the configuration in the admin section (testing that) then test with liveValidation disabled, and still under 4 minutes but that's because the JohnSmith user is deleted and liveValidation active status is checked for each test by a pair of scripts.  
sanyam left at 09:35 (Quit: Page closed  
vmassol - (09:35): 4 minutes for RegisterTest, indeed that's long  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:35): pentium 4 :)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:36): That's what it was before (3 and something.)  
vmassol - (09:36): just make sure you test only what's needed  
vmassol - (09:36): ie there's no need to retest the same thing in several tests  
vmassol - (09:36): (not sure if this applies here I haven't checked the code)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:37): That's the time for running the test that maven returns so it includes setup.  
vmassol - (09:37): re velocity script I don't know, I would say it's best to avoid this trick as much as possible since it introduced complexity  
vmassol - (09:37): so if you havea nother way of achieving the same result it's better to use this other way  
vmassol - (09:37): s/introduced/introduces/  
vmassol - (09:37): I'd need to look at your code to provide better ideas though  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:38): I can do that, it just means login as admin and view the admin app for each of 8 tests.  
vmassol - (09:38): but yes what's really iumportant  
vmassol - (09:38): is to reduce the test execution time to the minimum  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:39): I hate for the tests to depend on their order (if livevalidation active status isn't checked per test.)  
vmassol - (09:39): order is not a problem at all  
vmassol - (09:40): for functional tests  
vmassol - (09:40): you can force the order  
vmassol - (09:41): (for unit tests I'd hate to depend on the order though)  
vmassol - (09:41): the reason is that setting the app/DB in a given state is usually very expensive  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:42): I suppose I can just set livevalidation true, then do the livevalidation tests, then set it false and do the non-livevalidation tests.  
vmassol - (09:55): jvelociter: I was wrong, passing the lcoation of the resource dir is not a good idea  
vmassol - (09:56): also it's not needed  
vmassol - (09:56): since almost all IDE support maven projects now you don't need to do anything I believe  
vmassol - (09:57): (and if the dir was passed you'd need to configure your test execution in your IDE to specify the dir which would be even a greater pain)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:09): Forcing order of tests means just putting the methods in that order?  
vmassol - (10:10): nope  
vmassol - (10:10): the order of methods is not guaranteed at all  
vmassol - (10:10): order means using a test suite to control the order  
vmassol - (10:10): you can do this easily by introducing a suite() method in your TestCase class (in junit 3.x)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:11): Okay, I wasn't sure what I should be searching for, thanks.  
vmassol - (10:11): (btw the reason the method order is not guaranteed is because methods are disocvered by reflection in the default suite  
vmassol - (10:11): and reflection doesn't guarantee any order  
vmassol - (10:11): )  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:12): I see.  
vmassol - (10:12): in junit 4 it's with @RunWith annotation  
vmassol - (10:13): but I don't know exactly how to do it with junit4  
vmassol - (10:13): see http://radio.javaranch.com/lasse/2006/07/27/1154024535662.html  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:13): BTW: I couldn't get any tests to run until I changed selenium back to the older version.  
vmassol - (10:13): oh?  
vmassol - (10:13): what's wrong?  
vmassol - (10:13): is hudson fine?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:13): Seems the new version handles 404s as errors.  
vmassol - (10:14): hudson shows error  
vmassol - (10:14): just checked  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:14): I thought hudson was shut down due to lack of mail.  
vmassol - (10:14): for ex: http://hudson.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-product-enterprise-tests/com.xpn.xwiki.products$xwiki-enterprise-test-selenium/570/testReport/com.xpn.xwiki.it.selenium/DeletePageTest/testDeleteOkWhenConfirming/  
vmassol - (10:15): hmmm so we're sending a 404 when we edit a page that doesn't exist?  
vmassol - (10:15): it's delete here  
vmassol - (10:15): not edit  
vmassol - (10:15): I think I remember sergiu doing this  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:16): PageExists isn't working either for the same reason.  
vmassol - (10:17): we need to understand what's the pb  
vmassol - (10:21): they've probably added support for error codes  
vmassol - (10:21): and since we return non 200 error codes it fails now  
vmassol - (10:22): trying to find their sources  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:24): http://code.google.com/p/selenium/  
vmassol - (10:24): http://selenium.googlecode.com/svn/selenium-rc/trunk/clients/java/src/main/java/com/thoughtworks/selenium/DefaultSelenium.java  
vmassol - (10:25): http://code.google.com/p/selenium/source/browse/selenium-rc/trunk/clients/java/src/main/java/com/thoughtworks/selenium/DefaultSelenium.java  
vmassol - (10:25): ahaha  
vmassol - (10:25): public void open(String url, String ignoreResponseCode) {  
vmassol - (10:26): we should try with "true"  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:27): Good find.  
vmassol - (10:28): the jira issue is http://jira.openqa.org/browse/SEL-684  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:28): Should we just go ahead and use true universally or are there uses for failing with error response code?  
vmassol - (10:28): "As of now, open() command navigates directly to the page. Instead of that, provide checkedOpen functionality, which makes AJAX request to the page being opened and if the AJAX request fails then report back the failure along with HTTP code back to the user.  
vmassol - (10:28): Attached patch contains version-1 implementation for checkedOpen. In this patch, I am making ajax HEAD request to the URL being opened and checking for the HTTP status on completion of the ajax request. If this results in 404 or any other error code then the open() throws SeleniumError exception providing information about the http response code.  
vmassol - (10:28): "  
vmassol - (10:29): for us I think we could ignore the result for now  
vmassol - (10:29): the real question is whether we're right to return error codes  
vmassol - (10:29): sergiu seemed to think so but I didn't follow that discussion  
vmassol - (10:30): it's really strange that selenium broke backward compat with this  
vmassol - (10:30): they should have added the new method and kept the old behavior  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:31): Yes. That is the only thing I admire about Microsoft, 20 year old APIs mostly unbroken.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:31): Their code must be a mess though.  
vmassol - (10:32): just commented: http://jira.openqa.org/browse/SEL-684?focusedCommentId=19383&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#action\_19383  
vmassol - (10:32): :)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:34): So I'm not the only one.  
vmassol - (10:38): hmm I don't see the api avail in our version  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:48): I gather we're working with this: http://code.google.com/p/selenium/source/browse/selenium-rc/tags/REL-1.0.1/clients/java/src/main/java/com/thoughtworks/selenium/DefaultSelenium.java  
vmassol - (10:58): we should be on 1.0.2  
vmassol - (10:58): check the pom.xml  
vmassol - (10:58): it says 1.0.2  
vmassol - (11:00): http://repo2.maven.org/maven2/org/codehaus/mojo/selenium-maven-plugin/1.0.1/selenium-maven-plugin-1.0.1.pom says 1.0.2 too  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:00): I can't find a version 1.0.2 on the site.  
vmassol - (11:00): what site?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:00): The source tree on google code.  
vmassol - (11:00): http://code.google.com/p/selenium/source/browse/selenium-rc/tags/ ?  
vmassol - (11:00): hmm  
vmassol - (11:00): strange  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:01): I did find another seemingly relevant issue: http://jira.openqa.org/browse/SRC-563  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:02): Interesting link on the page "farewell to the soft 404" says soft 404s confuse googlebot.  
vmassol - (11:03): sources can be found here: http://repo1.maven.org/maven2/org/seleniumhq/selenium/client-drivers/selenium-java-client-driver/1.0.2/  
vmassol - (11:05): so indeed it's not there  
vmassol - (11:06): one solution is to extend DefaultSelenium to get access to the commandprocessor I guess  
vmassol - (11:06): but that's a pain  
vmassol - (11:06): 1.0.3 has been released too  
vmassol - (11:06): let me check if it's in there  
vmassol - (11:06): (but it's not in a maven repo yet)  
vmassol - (11:08): carlos has also updated the selenium maven plugin to use 1.0.3  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:09): Hmm, lights flickering and national grid is reporting outages on 3 sides of me, I might loose power for the day.  
vmassol - (11:09): oops :)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:09): s/loose/lose  
vmassol - (11:09): haha  
vmassol - (11:10): you live in the UK right?  
vmassol - (11:10): ;)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:10): Do they loose power a lot?  
vmassol - (11:10): seems so  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:10): \*lose  
vmassol - (11:11): they loose power  
vmassol - (11:11): but you lose power  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:11): Funny thing is the wire I'm on feeds a bunch of Vermont so it gets fixed fast even though I live in the middle of nowhere.  
vmassol - (11:12): actually 1.0.3 is only the server  
vmassol - (11:12): the latest client is still 1.0.2  
vmassol - (11:14): ok will try extending DefaultSelenium  
vmassol - (11:23): I'm running the full functional test suite locally to see if my change fixes the pb  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:26): Cool, I couldn't get one test to run.  
daning joined #xwiki at 11:37  
vmassol - (11:46): hmm it fails locally but with other errors  
vmassol - (11:46): I don't know if they're caused by my change or not  
vmassol - (11:46): they don't seem  
vmassol - (11:46): I'll commit  
vmassol - (11:46): and revert if it doesn't gelp  
vmassol - (11:46): help  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 11:51  
vmassol left at 11:52 (Quit: Leaving.  
tmortagne joined #xwiki at 11:52  
daning left #xwiki at 11:53  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:54): Still not finding anything about how to order test cases, Everything I see is how to order the Tests (classes) in the suite but not the cases (methods) in the test.  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 11:56  
tmortagne - (11:57): CalebJamesDeLisl: it's not supposed to matter in a proper unit test where all test methods are isolated so i guess there is nothing to order them  
vmassol - (11:57): tmortagne: we were talking about functional tests  
vmassol - (11:58): bbiab  
tmortagne - (11:58): vmassol: just seen last message of CalebJamesDeLisl  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:58): While you were gone I said: Still not finding anything about how to order test cases, Everything I see is how to order the Tests (classes) in the suite but not the cases (methods) in the test.  
tmortagne - (11:59): yes that's what i saw but i tough you where speaking about junit  
sdumitriu - (11:59): CalebJamesDeLisl: You should not depend on the order of the tests  
sdumitriu - (11:59): A test is supposed to be standalone  
sdumitriu - (11:59): Right vmassol?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (12:00): Was trying to get a little extra performance by changing state in the middle of a test (so the TestCases would not need do a check each time.)  
tmortagne - (12:01): CalebJamesDeLisl: you committed new resgistration admin translation keys only on trunk ? :(  
tmortagne - (12:01): just tested 2.2.1 release  
tmortagne - (12:02): hmm wait  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (12:02): That went into 2.2.1? I thought that was already released.  
tmortagne - (12:03): CalebJamesDeLisl: is it normal to have lot's of things $msg.get('core.register.title') in the input of http://127.0.0.1:8080/xwiki/bin/admin/XWiki/XWikiPreferences?editor=globaladmin&section=Registration page ?  
tmortagne - (12:03): CalebJamesDeLisl: what was already released ?  
tmortagne - (12:04): actually i guess it's normal  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (12:04): Yes, normal  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (12:04): It's configuration.  
tmortagne - (12:04): sorry, seemed weird at first sight to see so many $msg.get ;)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (12:04): Gave me a good scare :)  
tmortagne - (12:05): :)  
tmortagne - (12:05): what did you fixed yesterday ? so that i test that  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (12:05): If it wasn't working you would see no title or welcome message on the registration page.  
tmortagne - (12:06): ok great  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (12:06): Now I should backport those keys before I forget and you try to release 2.2.2 correct?  
tmortagne - (12:06): i was afraid that maven took the old web-standard from some cache instead of the one i re-released  
tmortagne - (12:06): you have time before 2.2.2 there is no date for it  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (12:07): I'll go ahead and do it before I forget.  
tmortagne - (12:07): actually WDYT exactly ?  
tmortagne - (12:07): theses translations keys are not part of 2.2.1 ?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (12:07): No.  
tmortagne - (12:07): so it doe snot work ?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (12:08): I only added the code to use them after you released.  
tmortagne - (12:08): ok so this asmin UI simplydo nothing, nothing is broken ?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (12:09): If you are admin and you go to bin/register/XWiki/Registration you will see a couple of links at the bottom.  
tmortagne - (12:09): yes i see them  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (12:10): I made them into translation keys seeing how other applications translate admin features.  
tmortagne - (12:11): sure but these link are not broken, i can see "You  can configure this application by clicking here." and "You  can add, remove and change fields in this form by clicking here."  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (12:11): Good, those are what I changed.  
tmortagne - (12:11): ok  
tmortagne - (12:12): testing a couple of other things and i will start announcements  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (12:14): So am I to understand that there should be no dependance on the order of execution of methods in a selenium test?  
tmortagne - (12:16): CalebJamesDeLisl: from JAVA POV yes but since we keep the same database to not take days to execute tests there is a kind of dependance  
nickless joined #xwiki at 12:16  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (12:19): I can log in as admin and set livevalidation for each test or set it twice and try to make the test cases execute in order. Any preference?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (12:19): test meaning test case (method).  
tmortagne - (12:20): CalebJamesDeLisl: best would be to make tests cases as independent as possible IMO  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (12:21): Can do. I'll run a test and tell what the performance difference is.  
tmortagne - (12:22): CalebJamesDeLisl: ok  
sdumitriu - (12:36): tmortagne: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise221 is wrong  
sdumitriu - (12:36): (the title)  
tmortagne - (12:37): sdumitriu:  indeed, thanks for the catch i'm fixing it  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (12:55): Well the test runs in 5 1/2 minutes or 3 1/2 minutes with the hack to eliminate checking the liveValidation parameter each time.  
vmassol - (12:55): sdumitriu: for unit tests yes, for functional tests, it's a common good practice to define the order of execution  
vmassol - (12:55): functional tests by definition require an environment  
vmassol - (12:55): and restoring the environment to a given state before each is usually too expensive  
vmassol - (12:56): so usually the env is restored only at the beginning of the test suite  
vmassol - (12:56): lunch time  
tmortagne left at 13:09 (Quit: Leaving.  
mflorea left at 15:09 (Quit: Leaving.  
sematicweboholic left at 15:20 (Ping timeout: 260 seconds  
daning joined #xwiki at 15:50  
daning - (15:56): Hello  
sdumitriu - (15:57): Hi  
daning - (15:58): I am in http://l10n.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XE/XWikiCoreResources, I am trying to add some Chinese translation.  
daning - (15:58): The Simplified Chinese (zh) Total translations is 2414. Where get this number?  
sdumitriu - (15:59): It's computed from the values existing in the wiki  
daning - (16:00): Diff languages have diff number.  
sdumitriu - (16:01): Yes, that's normal  
sdumitriu - (16:01): Those are present translations  
sdumitriu - (16:01): Normally, present + empty should be the same number  
sdumitriu - (16:01): Or no  
sdumitriu - (16:02): OK, I have no idea why that number is different  
daning - (16:02): Are the ApplicationResources\_\*\*.properties in the xwiki-core-\*\*.jar created from data in   http://l10n.xwiki.org/?  
sdumitriu - (16:08): Yes  
sdumitriu - (16:09): Before each release we take the data from the wiki and commit it  
daning - (16:40): But I find more zh translations in ApplicationResources\_zh.properties than  http://l10n.xwiki.org/  
sematicweboholic joined #xwiki at 16:47  
sematicweboholic left at 17:23 (Ping timeout: 245 seconds  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 17:26  
daning left at 17:29 (Quit: ??
